messages.title: A champion for our community
messages.content: Roberta is a long-standing champion who promotes sound, sustainable environmental causes and working on important local cancer and blood donation initiatives.

messages.title: Working hard for our future
messages.content: Investing in education, protecting pensions, improving social care and creating opportunities for young people.

messages.title: Investing in our communities
messages.content: Working to bring more jobs and opportunities, standing up for public services, and investing in community partnerships for better facilities and environmental protection.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Roberta has a record of environmental causes, including promoting sustainable energy alternatives.
Aiming to ensure fair opportunities and continued provision for young people in the education system.
Working for a higher standard of Social Care and better services for those needing care.
Roberta led a successful campaign to restrict the number of Article 4 Directions relating to HMOs in Durham.

mentions.tacticalSituation: It’s close between Labour and the Tories / UKIP in Durham. Every vote counts, then please vote Labour in 2017.

issues.economy: Bringing jobs and opportunities to Durham, supporting small businesses.
issues.education: Campaign against unfair Tory School cuts.
issues.health: As a vocal supporter of the NHS, fighting privatisation and longer waiting times.

housing.content: Roberta has been pressing for more good quality, affordable and family housing in our villages and city centre. She will continue to push for the homes we desperately need.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am delighted to have been elected once again as the Labour candidate for the City of Durham constituency for the General Election 2017.

politicalExperience.duration: Since first being elected as Durham’s MP in 2005
politicalExperience.achievements: Took up more than 40,000 issues. Leading campaigns on various community concerns.

images.caption: Roberta engaging with constituents and participating in community events.
Campaigning for better public services and community facilities.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Since being elected as Durham's MP in 2005 I have fought to be a strong voice and to do again what you supported me to do before.
